text: And He God says of the believers Indeed God shall admit those who believe and perform righteous deeds into gardens underneath which rivers flow; adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl read wa-lu’lu’in genitive to mean bracelets made of both elements so that the pearls are set in gold; or read wa-lu’lu’an accusative as a supplement to the syntactical locus of min asāwira ‘bracelets’; and their raiment therein will be silk namely the one forbidden for men to wear in this world.
